meaningMnemonic: 並ぶ is when something is lining up. 並べる is when you're lining something up. In other words, 並べる is transitive. It means <vocabulary>to line something up</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to put something in order</vocabulary>. You know this because when it comes to <reading>bear</reading>s (べる), you have to line them up yourself, because they won't be doing it for you, that's for sure.
readingMnemonic: The reading of the kanji is same as for 並ぶ, so if you know that you can figure out the reading for this one as well.
